text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies! Today I have a very special

Ro: guest, my friend John Bane, AKA, otherwise
known as Totalbiscuit!

TB: Greetings! Ro: Yes! TB: We’re gonna
be making something, hopefully delicious

TB: today, I would think. Ro: Yes, this has
been requested so much by fans, they

Ro: were like, please make biscuits with Totalbiscuit!
But we’re gonna make very geeky ones.

TB: We are! Ro: We’re gonna make Half Life
Biscuits. TB: Mmmm, American biscuits

TB: as well. This is really gonna confuse
our UK audience, because some people

TB: don’t know, Biscuits in the US, completely
different to biscuits in the UK.

Ro: Yes, they are. TB: Entirely different
things. Ro: In the UK aren’t they

Ro: like cookies? TB: They’re basically
cookies, yeah, I, we have, the weird thing

TB: is we have cookies as well, but that’s
usually American imports like Oreos

TB: and we brand them as cookies. But, then
we have biscuits which are the same
TB: thing, because we love to confuse people.

Ro: The things you will need today, will be:
a sharp cutting knife, a pan,

Ro: a paintbrush, a potato smasher, a whisk,
a very fancy ruler, a cutting board,

Ro: and a mixing cup. TB: You will also need:
Some Pam spray, flour, baking soda,

TB: baking powder, as well as some sea salt,
some 3 inch biscuit cutters,

TB: I’m gonna stay away from those. Heavy
whipping cream, cultured buttermilk, a

TB: large mixing bowl, and inside the mixing
bowl you will find some disgustingly

TB: pink measuring cups. Ro: Awesomely pink!
His favorite color!

TB: Disgracefully pink measuring cups, as
well as some measuring spoons, tablespoon

TB: and teaspoon sized. If they’re not this
pink, the whole thing won’t work!

TB: Just making you aware of that, that is
an essential part of the recipe.

Ro: That is a fact! It’s in the recipe.
TB: Yeah, that’s science, you can’t
TB: argue with science. Ro: You can’t!
Ro: Let’s put this all together.

Ro: Now we are gonna add flour, John if you
will!

TB: I’m… Ro: Yes, we’re gonna add 4
cups. TB: I’m not sure I can use this, it’s just,

TB: it’s not my color! But I’ll try, I’ll
make an attempt!

TB: So we need 4 cups of this stuff.
Ro: Yeah, 4 cups.

TB: OK… First cup. Ro: And just put it in
a big mixing bowl, right in there.

it’s totally fine!
Ro: Inhale it, it’s good for your nose.

promise! Alright, second one.
Ro: Don’t inhale it, that was a joke kids.

Ro: 1 more! 1 More! TB: I am absolutely pro at this,
there’s no question!
Ro: I like the shaking technique, that’s perfect!

TB: Nautrally, shake it a little bit inside the bag so
it doesn’t go all over, then, then dump it in.

Ro: Now we’re gonna do 4 teaspoons of baking
powder.

Ro: 1 tablespoon of baking sowder… Wait,
what did I just say?
TB: Baking sowder. Ro: Baking sowder….

TB: You’ve created a new and powerful weapon
today. Ro: Baking sowder!

Ro: 1 teaspoon of salt. TB: Salt, let’s
see, don’t pour, don’t do this over the

TB: bowl, this is a recipe for disaster. Ro:
Unless you want it really salty!
TB: I wouldn’t recommend that.

TB: There we go. Ro: There we go! 
TB: That seems reasonable. Ro: Perfect!

Ro: Now we’re gonna whisk it all together.
TB: I have the power!
Ro: Whisk that together!

Ro: Oh nice! I’ll hold in the fog. TB: Yes.
Ro: The powder fog!

TB: Don’t inhale this. Ro: Don’t inhale,
hold your breath!
TB: Are we good?
TB: Or does, or is more whisking required?
Ro: OK, OK, we… TB: Perfect!

Ro: I almost forgot, the butter, how could
I do that, I don’t know, but you’re
Ro: gonna need 1-1/2 stick, which is 12 tablespoons. And so we're  just gonna cut

Ro: 1 of these in 1/2. And then you’re gonna
cut these into cubes. And then place

Ro: them, sprinkle them on top of our flour
bowl mixture.

Ro: Alright, you’re just gonna take these
little cubes and make it rain butter!

Ro: Make it rain! Make it rain! I make it
rain! I make it rain!

Ro: Alright, now you’re… TB: I want to
eat them… Ro: gonna take your potato

Ro: smasher, or you can use a fork, but I
would suggest this. And smash away!

TB: Do we need violence? I can do that. Ro:
Yeah, violence! Violence! Violence!
TB: Violence… Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!

Ro: Kids, this is why violences is not a good idea!
TB: Slightly less violence.

Ro: Last step, just pour in the buttercream,
and it’s really, really thick.

Ro: It’s like 2%, 2%, 2% milk. TB: It
smells like cardiac arrest.
Ro: A berm, a berm, a berm, a berrmm… TB: There you go.

Ro: Mix it some more, until it starts to feel
like dough.
Ro: And then we’ll roll it out!

Ro: Once your 
dough looks like this, it’s time to roll
it out, only we’re

Ro: not gonna use a rolling pin, we’re gonna
use our hands!

Ro: Just sprinkle some flour onto the table,
a little light sprinkle, and this

Ro: is where I’m taking the ruler and we’re
gonna roll the dough out to be about 10

Ro; inches by 10 inches, so it’s not very
big.

Ro: Now you’re just gonna kind of flatten
it with your hands. For dinner biscuits
Ro: you don’t need to use a, a rolling pin.

Ro: Now we’re gonna grease the pan, take
your Pam baking spray
Ro: and just lightly coat it.

Ro: OK, I’m ready, go! TB: Are you sure?
Ro: Yeah, I’m ready, I’m ready!
TB: You don’t look ready!
Ro: I'm ready... A-ha-ha-ha, so funny!

Ro: Did you get it? Get in the corners? TB:
Yeah, I think so.

TB: It’s fine. Ro: Is it good? TB: Yeah,
it’s fine. Ro: Ah, wow, wow!

Ro: OK, now you’re gonna take your biscuit
cutter, and these are 3 inch, they

Ro: come in different, uh, sizes, but we’re
using the 3 inch. Just a reminder.

Ro: And just press down, give it a little
jiggle, and it should pop out.

Ro: Oh yeah! TB: Except when it doesn’t…
Ro: And then put it onto the tray.
Ro: Perfect!

Ro: Now once you’ve got all your biscuits
on the tray, we’re gonna make the

Ro: little Half Life symbol out of the dough
to go on top of them.

Ro: Roll ‘em out, put them diagonal, then
pinch the top and the bottom.

Ro: These don’t have to be perfect, just
kind of eyeball it.

be perfect!
TB: This is a failed science experiment!

TB: This, this is… Ro: He, he kinda looks

dead! I’m so sorry!

here’s the Half Life logo!
TB: This, this came from zen itself!

Ro: This is the Totalbiscuit biscuit! TB: It’s fallen
to pieces.

the Totalbiscuit biscuit.

TB: That’s not any greek letter that I know
of…

Ro: Once you got all of your Half Life Designs,
and TB designs on your biscuits.

TB: That was totally intentional right? Ro:
Yeah, totally, totally. TB: Absolutely, I meant to do that.

Ro: Yep, he did a great job. TB: Please don’t
kill me Gabe, please.

Ro: Then you’re just gonna take the paintbrush,
dip it in a little bit of

Ro: heavy whipping cream, and lightly coat
the top of the biscuits.

Ro: Once you’re done painting the top of
these biscuits, you’re gonna set your

Ro: oven to 450 and you’re gonna put them
in and bake for 12 minutes.

Ro: Ta-da! We have finished our Half Life
Biscuits! Take a gander, and we even got TB’s

Ro: Totalbiscuits! TB: Wake up Mr. Freeman,
wake up and smell the biscuits.

my favorite 1! Out of all of them!

it.

it still kind of looks delicious.

Ro: Yeah, we should taste them.
TB: This guy’s edible.

Ro: I want to taste 1. TB: Mmm! Ro: How was
it? TB: Mmm!

Ro: Flaky? Buttercream-y? TB: Flaky, buttercream-y.
Ro: Can I eat the T?
TB: You can, you can try. Not bad at all.
Ro: Mmmm! Those are really good! TB: Mmm!

Ro: Thanks you guys for watching, Nerdy Nummies!
And thank you Mr. John Bane,

Ro: Totalbiscuit for being here. TB: No problem

art to someone more capable than me.

I’ll do the decorating,
Ro: it will be perfect!
